title: Optimizing technologies for discovering cancer cell mutations

title_detail.value: Optimizing technologies for discovering cancer cell mutations

summary: Cancer cells often have mutations in their DNA that can give scientists clues about how the cancer started or which treatment may be most effective. Finding these mutations can be difficult, but a new method may offer more complete, comprehensive results. A team of researchers has developed a new framework that can combine three existing methods of finding these large mutations -- or structural variants -- into a single, more complete picture.
